title: How to Use Calculator on a Mac

steps.title: Double Click on the Icon to open it.
steps.content: Double Click on the Icon to open it. You should then come to a screen looking like this.

steps.title: If it is a simple problem you can leave it on this screen.
steps.content: If it is a simple problem you can leave it on this screen. Such as, what is 80 percent of 340.

steps.title: You can clear the number in Calculator’s display window or clear only the last digit entered.
steps.content: You can clear the number in Calculator’s display window or clear only the last digit entered.

steps.title: To clear the number in the display window, click the C key in Calculator
steps.content: To clear the number in the display window, click the C key in Calculator

steps.title: To delete the last digit entered, press the Delete key on your keyboard.
steps.content: To delete the last digit entered, press the Delete key on your keyboard.

steps.title: When using Calculator, you can have the computer speak each button you click and tell you the result of a calculation.
steps.content: When using Calculator, you can have the computer speak each button you click and tell you the result of a calculation.

steps.title: To have the computer speak the value or function of each key you click, choose Speech > Speak Button Pressed.
steps.content: To have the computer speak the value or function of each key you click, choose Speech > Speak Button Pressed.

steps.title: To have the computer speak the result of a calculation when you click the Equal Sign key (=), choose Speech > Speak Result.
steps.content: To have the computer speak the result of a calculation when you click the Equal Sign key (=), choose Speech > Speak Result.

steps.title: The programmer’s calculator performs calculations that programmers frequently use.
steps.content: The programmer’s calculator performs calculations that programmers frequently use. It can convert values to hexadecimal, octal, or decimal; perform logical operations; display your results in binary; and rotate or shift bits.

steps.title: Choose View > Programmer.
steps.content: Choose View > Programmer.

steps.title: The programmer’s calculator works with integers only.
steps.content: The programmer’s calculator works with integers only. There is no decimal point. If a computation results in a floating-point number, the decimal is truncated. For example, if you enter 99 / 10 =, the result is 9.

steps.title: The Decimal Places setting in the View menu doesn’t affect the programmer’s calculator.
steps.content: The Decimal Places setting in the View menu doesn’t affect the programmer’s calculator. The Paper Tape and memory functions aren’t available for the programmer’s calculator.

steps.title: You can round results by specifying a given number of decimal places.
steps.content: You can round results by specifying a given number of decimal places.

steps.title: Choose View > Decimal Places, and then choose the number of decimal places you want displayed.
steps.content: Choose View > Decimal Places, and then choose the number of decimal places you want displayed.

steps.title: To add the displayed value to the value in memory, click M+.
steps.content: To add the displayed value to the value in memory, click M+.

steps.title: To subtract the displayed value from the value in memory, click M-.
steps.content: To subtract the displayed value from the value in memory, click M-.

steps.title: To recall the value in memory and use it in a calculation, click MR.
steps.content: To recall the value in memory and use it in a calculation, click MR.

steps.title: To clear the memory, click MC.
steps.content: To clear the memory, click MC.

steps.title: You can use Calculator to convert currency values from one currency to another.
steps.content: You can use Calculator to convert currency values from one currency to another.

steps.title: Enter the original value in Calculator.
steps.content: Enter the original value in Calculator.

steps.title: Choose Convert > Currency.
steps.content: Choose Convert > Currency.

steps.title: Choose the original currency from the From pop-up menu and the currency you want to convert to from the To pop-up menu.
steps.content: Choose the original currency from the From pop-up menu and the currency you want to convert to from the To pop-up menu.

steps.title: Click OK.
steps.content: Click OK.

steps.title: Enter the original value in Calculator.
steps.content: Enter the original value in Calculator.

steps.title: Choose Convert > any measurement category.
steps.content: Choose Convert > any measurement category. Categories include Length,Temperature, Power, Speed, and so on.

steps.title: Choose the original unit of measure from the From pop-up menu and the unit of measure you want to convert to from the To pop-up menu.
steps.content: Choose the original unit of measure from the From pop-up menu and the unit of measure you want to convert to from the To pop-up menu.
